blockId.description: The Notion Block to get all children from, when using 'By URL' mode make sure to use the URL of the block itself, you can find it in block parameters in Notion under 'Copy link to block'

type.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

text.description: Text content. This field contains the actual content of your text and is probably the field you'll use most often.

textLink.description: The URL that this link points to

mentionType.description: An inline mention of a user, page, database, or date. In the app these are created by typing @ followed by the name of a user, page, database, or a date.

user.description: The ID of the user being mentioned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

page.description: The ID of the page being mentioned

range.description: Whether or not you want to define a date range

date.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

dateStart.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

dateEnd.description: An ISO 8601 formatted date, with optional time. Represents the end of a date range.

annotationUi.description: All annotations that apply to this rich text

strikethrough.description: Whether the text is struck through

code.description: Whether the text is code style

checked.description: Whether the to_do is checked or not

returnAll.description: Whether to return all results or only up to a given limit

limit.description: Max number of results to return

databaseId.description: The Notion Database to operate on

simple.description: Whether to return a simplified version of the response instead of the raw data

property.description: The name of the property to filter by

value.description: The value of the property to filter by

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against

title.description: Page title. Appears at the top of the page and can be found via Quick Find.

key.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

text.description: Text content. This field contains the actual content of your text and is probably the field you'll use most often.

textLink.description: The URL that this link points to

mentionType.description: An inline mention of a user, page, database, or date. In the app these are created by typing @ followed by the name of a user, page, database, or a date.

user.description: The ID of the user being mentioned. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

page.description: The ID of the page being mentioned

range.description: Whether or not you want to define a date range

date.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

dateStart.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

dateEnd.description: An ISO 8601 formatted date, with optional time. Represents the end of a date range.

annotationUi.description: All annotations that apply to this rich text

strikethrough.description: Whether the text is struck through

code.description: Whether the text is code style

phoneValue.description: Phone number. No structure is enforced.

multiSelectValue.description: Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression

selectValue.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

statusValue.description: Name of the option you want to set. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

peopleValue.description: List of users. Multiples can be defined separated by comma. Choose from the list, or specify IDs using an expression.

relationValue.description: List of databases that belong to another database. Multiples can be defined separated by comma.

checkboxValue.description: Whether or not the checkbox is checked. true represents checked. false represents unchecked.

range.description: Whether or not you want to define a date range

includeTime.description: Whether or not to include the time in the date

date.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

dateStart.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

dateEnd.description: An ISO 8601 formatted date, with optional time. Represents the end of a date range.

timezone.description: Time zone to use. By default n8n timezone is used. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

pageId.description: The Page URL from Notion's 'copy link' functionality (or just the ID contained within the URL)

key.description: The name of the property to filter by. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

condition.description: The value of the property to filter by

phoneNumberValue.description: Phone number. No structure is enforced.

multiSelectValue.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

selectValue.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

statusValue.description: Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression

peopleValue.description: List of users. Multiples can be defined separated by comma. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

createdByValue.description: List of users. Multiples can be defined separated by comma. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

lastEditedByValue.description: List of users. Multiples can be defined separated by comma. Choose from the list, or specify an ID using an expression.

checkboxValue.description: Whether or not the checkbox is checked. true represents checked. false represents unchecked

date.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

createdTimeValue.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

lastEditedTime.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time

dateValue.description: An ISO 8601 format date, with optional time
